intro: Pimpinella cretica var. lasiopetala, commonly known as the Cretan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-shaped clusters called umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
